results.title: Trains remembered. - Volume 2.
results.brief_description: Steam trains predominate in this unique and exciting video which features rare archival footage together with more recent material. Amongst the railway lines appearing are Little Kimble, Marlow, Colnbrook and Epping. A4’s and A2’s feature on the Kings Cross line, N2’s appear on suburban trains to Moorgate. Class 76 Electrics are shown on the Woodhead Line and in action in Holland for the last time in 1986. Witness the re-opening of the Isle of Man Steam Railway and the Kingsmoor Depot near Carlisle in 1966 which featured many steam trains.

results.title: Trains remembered. - Volume 1.
results.brief_description: Using archival footage and an informative commentary enthusiasts will be treated to a nostalgic look at the great days of railway. This volume captures steam and diesel engines dating as far back as the 1930’s including early green DMU’s, commuter trains at Liverpool Station in 1932, wartime NE A4’s and Class 78 Electrics, the Belfast 5‘3” gauge to Larne, 1950’s steam shed scenes, DEMU’s and in the 60’s KESR is taken over by the preservationists, trains at Euston, Paddington and Clapham, the last Brighton Belle, King George visits Paddington and finally a Bullied locomotive re-born in preservation.

results.title: Training to win
results.creator_credit: John Hallowell and National Football League of Australia
results.brief_description:
Demonstrates some of the lesser known drills used by Tom Hafey, David Parkin and Ron Barassi, and features Collingwood, Hawthorn and North Melbourne players in training sequences. Excellent for showing the variety that can be introduced into seminar training.
Football sequences courtesy of Channel 7.

results.title: Training for development
results.brief_description: Demonstrates the practical assistance given to several students from developing countries by the Australian Development Assistance Bureau. The students are given short practical courses designed to meet the needs of the government.

results.title: Training a navy
results.brief_description: An information film on the Royal Australian Navy’s main shore training establishment, HMAS Cerberus at Westernport, Victoria. It shows recruits undergoing basic and advanced training, the general routine at Cerberus, and sporting and recreational activities.

results.title: Trained to serve
results.creator_credit: Graham Wallace, Crown Film Unit and Kosmos Film Produktion
results.brief_description: One of a series of film designed to show the rest of the world the problems facing the Control Commission of the Western Zone of occupied Germany. This film deals with the forming and running of a new German police force. Against flashes of the past, when the police were a terror to every citizen, the promotion of a new police force under British and American guidance is traced.

results.title: Tragedy or triumph
results.creator_credit: Krishna Singh, Edward Magruder Jones and United Nations Television
results.brief_description: At the World Food Conference in 1974, the international community assessed the dimensions of the world food crisis and attempted to mobilise support for specific programs to head off disaster. The film surveys the causes of the present world food situation and identifies some of the measures which could increase food production.
